column2: An outcome where the possible values are known, but the specific value it will take is not.
The process of creating values that are equally likely to occur, often used in simulations.
A method to model real-world situations by using random outcomes to mimic uncertainty.
A sequence of events representing a simulated scenario to observe possible outcomes.
A part of a simulation using random digits to model simple random occurrences.
A variable that records the result of each trial in a simulation, reflecting the aspect of interest.
